alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Jackson; Overton; Putnam; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 9:29PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Overton, east central De Kalb, southeastern Jackson, northwestern White and Putnam Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 929 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Baxter, or 10 miles southwest of Cookeville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cookeville, Algood, Baxter, Hamptons Crossroads, Bakers Crossroads, Burgess Falls State Park, Rickman and Cummins Falls State Park. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 275 and 299. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: De Kalb; Jackson; Overton; Putnam; White
